results.title: Our lighthouse adventure
results.creator_credit: Lisa Kebbell and Queenscliff Primary School
results.brief_description:
Created as part of an investigation into the lighthouses of Queenscliff. The Queenscliff Primary School students wanted to write an adventure story in which they were the stars. It was also a way in which they could convey some of the information they had learnt about lighthouses to an audience in an entertaining way.
A photomontage accompanied by commentary from the students on CD ROM.

results.title: Queenscliff beaches; Our journey
results.creator_credit: Paul Jones and Queenscliff Primary School
results.brief_description:
This film is a learning outcome from the “Beaches” group student led investigation program at Queenscliff Primary School. It was undertaken as part of the 2007 Snapshots of Remote Communities Project and was overall winner of the Annual Sprockets and Flares Multimedia Awards.
A combination of softwares including Blue Sky technologies and artwork by the students was used in the creation of this work.
Two versions are included:
1. Queenscliff beaches - final product
2. Our journey - details the behind-the-scenes and process

results.title: A Memoir of the Bunurongs
results.brief_description: A brief memoir recording the sights, sounds and essence of Sorrento, a small seaside town nestled in between Portsea and Blairgowrie on the Mornington Peninsula. Evocative images are accompanied by a music soundtrack and text (in English).

results.title: One another
results.brief_description:
Two protagonists search for themselves/each other within morphing boundaries and shifting skies.
Charcoal drawing on erasure stop frame animation with live action video.
Music composed by Joseph Tawadros and performed by Joseph Tawadros, James Tawadros and Ben Rodgers.

results.title: Conservation conscious
results.creator_credit: Anna Jeffries, Australian Broadcasting Corporation and QPIX Ltd
results.brief_description:
Richard McDonald and Vicki Locke are two very dedicated and passionate art conservators who work from their solar-powered home in the Sunshine Coast Hinterland’s rainforest. Being “conservation conscious” is not only reflected in their work but also in their philosophy on life.
A mini-documentary written, directed and edited by Anna Jeffries with cinematography and music by Nick Batterham.

results.title: NOISE on film: noise for Darfur = Why should Australians make noise for Darfur?
results.creator_credit: Darfur Australia Network and Infinite Films
results.brief_description:
This documentary has been produced to raise awareness about the continuing tragedy in the Darfur region of Western Sudan and build solidarity between the Australian people and the people of Darfur.
The conflict in Darfur has been continuing for more than three years, has resulted in the deaths of more than 400,000 civilians, the displacement of at least 2.5 million people and there are currently 3.5 million people dependent upon insufficient international humanitarian aid. Darfur is in crisis and the genocide has to stop.
The film includes footage from refugee camps in Darfur, artwork and music from a range of local artists, and the perceptions of a range of influential Australians as to why Australians should make NOISE for Darfur.

results.title: Ozala
results.brief_description:
“Ozala” is an Afghani refugee who spent three years in a detention centre - his only crime was in wanting freedom. During this time in prison Ozala discovered the art of painting, where he could express his emotions, where shapes and colors became symbolic of his life and experiences and where he could escape to freedom. A thoughtful and reflective film interspersed with images of Ozala’s paintings.
In Farsi (Persian) with English subtitles

results.title: Chess
results.creator_credit: Salam Ziusudras, Australian Film Commission and Film and Television Institute (WA)
results.brief_description: A humorous documentary style film with a dark edge to it about a refugee filmmaker’s transition from the brutality of the detention centre to adjusting and adapting to the Aussie way of life, fashion and culture. Contains disturbing images. Written, directed and produced by Salam Ziusudras

results.title: Miriam of North Perth
results.creator_credit: Salam Ziusudras and Film and Television Institute (WA)
results.brief_description: A docudrama about a young woman from Iran who finds herself culturally alienated with the Australian way of life. Through her poetic narration she expresses her sense of isolation and loss of identity in this strange and different land. In Farsi with English subtitles.

results.title: Blood and water
results.brief_description:
A thought-provoking short film set in the future. Australia’s water has run out - as a result the government has restricted acces to water, issuing citizens with one container of water every three days. Civil unrest has broken out and the military has imposed martial law. This is the story of a father who must protect his daughter at all costs in a society where survival is paramount. Cast includes Tim Ferris, Pepita Emmerichs, Jeremy Kewley. Shot mainly in black and white with some color sequences.
Written and directed by Nicholas Carlton, produced by William Hardie.
